page.title: 04MEMORIES OF HORTON SCHOOL
page.content: Uncle Bob attended Horton School between 1931 and 1937, until he was fourteen years old.There were between 70 and 80 pupils and three teachers. The children had school meals for 2s and 6d per week at Chapel House. They were served a main meal and a pudding, usually boiled rice with a spoonful of jam or treacle.In winter they also had a cup of hot chocolate. Christmas parties were held at Horton Hall.There was a large decorated Christmas tree.On it was a wrapped present for every child.After tea and games they were given an orange, some sweets and a new shilling coin.The Harford family paid for it all. The headteacher's husband ran a boys' club after school. He would teach them to swim in the lake at Horton Court. Emma Cordy
